Cite Creator Settings


Instructions

When enabled, Cite Creator attempts to automatically compute a cite for the current page. Default PC shortcuts use Alt, default Mac shortcuts use Option.

ctrl+alt+c / ctrl+option+c - Copy the current cite, optionally including any selected text, e.g. card text

The letter grade on each cite is a rough metric of how confident you should be in its accuracy.

To manually modify parts of the cite, select text from the page and press:

ctrl+alt+1 / ctrl+option+1 - Author name
ctrl+alt+2 / ctrl+option+2 - Qualifications
ctrl+alt+3 / ctrl+option+3 - Date
ctrl+alt+4 / ctrl+option+4 - Title
ctrl+alt+5 / ctrl+option+5 - Publication


Cite Creator is designed primarily to produce cites for use in US high school or college debate, especially for use with the Verbatim template.

It works best on major news websites, and doesn't work in PDF's.

Cite Format

Standard
First Last, Quals, m-d-yyyy, "Title," Publication, URL

Frontloaded
First Last yy, Quals, m-d-yyyy, "Title," Publication, URL

Two-Line (not recommended)
Last yy
(First Last yy, Quals, m-d-yyyy, "Title," Publication, URL)

Custom

Enter your custom cite format above, e.g.:


%author%, %quals%, %date%, "%title%," %publication%, %url%, accessed %accessed%

You shouldn't use two-line cites.

Custom formats replace the codes between %'s, but retain all other text and whitespace. You can use the following codes:
%author% - Author's full name
%first% - Author's first name (mileage may vary)
%last% - Author's last name (mileage may vary)
%quals% - Author qualifications, if any
%date% - Full date
%y% - 1 or 2 digit year
%title% - Article title
%publication% - Publication
%url% - Full URL
%accessed% - Today's date
%linebreak% - Add a line break

Keyboard Shortcuts

Custom keyboard shortcuts must be a single string (no spaces) using hotkeys syntax, e.g.: ctrl+alt+c or command+option+1 or f2. Some shortcuts may conflict with built-in browser shortcuts or other extensions, so only change these if you know what you're doing. Changes require reloading the current page.
